data.title: Sholes' Savannah Directory, 1881
data.text:
PREFATORY

CENSUS.

In presenting our Third Annual Directory of Savannah, we recognize that

the work is not perfect, but we believe that it is as near so as the Directory o f

any city in the land.

The names herein number 12,841, which is a gain of 1,058.

The experienced men who take the census in connection with the Directory

canvass make a showing which cannot be disputed. The returns foot up 34,879

for the whole district comprised in the City Map. O f these 19,114 are white

and 15,765 colored.

The thanks o f the Publishers are due the enterprising business men and citi

zens for their encouragement, which enables us to bring forth a superior D irect

ory each year, and to add th e F ree Business D irectory of Savannah this

year, which w ill have a wide field of usefulness.

Credit is due T he Morning N ews Steam Printing H ouse for the neat

typographical and stereotype work.

W e w ill endeavor, in the future, to do what we have in the past-- improve,

and attain the highest standard.

Respectfully,

SH OLES & CO.

TO STREETS AND AVENUES IN SAVANNAH.

EXPLANATIONS.

Reference to the " Guide " w ill show th streets in alphabetical order, re

gardless o f location. To principal thoroughfares is added intersecting streets,

and, so far as practicable, corner numbers are given ; the northwest corner

whenever to be had, so if one wishes to find, say No. 156 South Broad, it

will be seen that No. 146 is at northwest corner o f Whitaker, and No. 168

northwest corner o f Barnard, hence, the number sought is between those

two streets. Many corners are destitute o f numbers, but to preserve uni

formity, they have been estimated and placed.

Streets are numbered from Bay, south, ancl from East Broad, west. Odd

numbers are on the South and west sides ; even numbers on the north and

east sides,

The lanes take their names from the streets immediately north of them;

thus Bay lane is the first lane south o f Bay street, running parallel therewith.

POST OFFICE.

T he Post Office is located on Bay street, southeast corner Drayton. La fayette M cLaws, postmaster; J. T. M cLaws, assistant; Wm. Cantwell,

Wm. McCormick, mailing clerks; Wm. Coolidge, Jr., distributing clerk.

Free D elivery-- L. B. Toomer, superintendent carriers; Thomas F. Murtagh, Thomas M. Noland, C. C. Deveaux, J. D . Boughes, Simeon B. Grant, T. A. Porter, A . S. Lafayette and Charles W . Green, carriers.

The post office departmeht promises to deliver by carriers only such mail matter as is directed to the street and number, and the only sure way to avoid having letters advertised, is to follow instructions o f the postal department by addressing letters as stated.

General D elivery-- Shem Cooper, clerk. W indow open daily from 9 a. m. to 6 p. m .; Sunday from 9.30 to 10.50 a. m ., A ll letters remaining un called for in the office, are advertised on Friday of each week, and if not claimed in one month, are forwarded to the dead letter office at Washington. W hen calling for such a letter, say " Advertised," and give full name and date of advertisement.

. Money Order D epartment-- J. T . M cLaws, money order clerk; M axwell H ill, assistant. Office opens 9 a. m. and closes 4 p. m. Absolute safety in send ing money by mail is secured by ob taining a money order on another money order office. No fractions o f cents to be introduced in an order. United States treasury notes or Naiional Bank notes only, received or paid. No single order issued for more than $50. Parties desiring to remit large sums must obtain additional orders. No applicant, however, can obtain in one day more than three orders, payable at the same office and to the same payee. Money orders can also be obtained at this office upon post offices in all parts of Canada, German States, Great Bri tain, Ireland, Italy and Switzerland. When foreign money orders are paid in currency, the gold value w ill be transmitted by the postmaster in N ew York. By act of Congress, approved March 3, 1875, the fees for domestic money orders are as fo llo w s: On or ders not over $15, ten cents; over $15 and under $30, fifteen cents; over $30 and under $40, twenty cents; over $40 and under $50, twenty-five cents. For foreign rates, consult the United States Official Postal Guide.
